page.title: 01Two Bridges, Dartmoor
page.content:
{ {Two Bridges - Dartmoor}
This area forms a small part of a granite plateau. The main soil type is peat, which supports a typical moorland vegetation.
The area is mainly treeless, save for the ancient oaks at Wistmans Wood and the plantation on Beardown Hill. Elsewhere the ground is covered mainly by heather.
The tors are the weathered remains of the granite intrusion into the country rock which took place many thousands of years ago, when molten rock was forced up through the Earths crust.
